newsitem.title: JAPAN: Belgium king calls for action to combat child sex.
newsitem.headline: Belgium king calls for action to combat child sex.

text.p: Belgium's King Albert called for international cooperation to stamp out the kind of exploitation of children and trade in humans seen in his country's paedophile scandal.
In a speech at a state banquet in his honour on Tuesday night, the king said Belgium and Japan must "act resolutely against these two terrible moral plagues".

"Lately my country has experienced a terrible tragedy in this context," King Albert said. "These dramas take on ever bigger international proportions, making an efficient cooperation between nations urgently needed."
The king and Queen Donna Paola arrived in Japan on Monday for a five-day state visit.

The uncovering this year of a child sex gang in Belgium which abducted, abused and -- in at least four cases -- murdered children has set off worldwide calls to protect children from paedophiles and stamp out child pornography.

Public outrage in Belgium over the scandal was exacerbated when the nation's top court removed a popular magistrate from investigations into the paedophile ring, ruling that he had compromised himself by accepting a free dinner from a support group specialising in helping the parents of missing children.
Earlier this week, hundreds of thousands of Belgians held a rally in Brussels to voice their anger at the judicial system.
